intro: Corydalis dolichocentra, commonly known as the long-stemmed corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its attractive floral display.
